Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or documentation provided to prove that Ferdinand Marcos Jr wrote the Senate Bill on free education.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Ferdinand Marcos Jr was the original author of Senate Bill 1304, but there is no evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that Ferdinand Marcos Jr was not the author of the bill, as evidenced by the list of authors provided in the official government records.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that Marcos is not listed as one of the authors of the free education bill, as shown in the Senate's online legislative archives.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the bill was authored by multiple senators, as evidenced by the official government records and timeline of the bill's passage into law.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting an unsupported claim and failing to provide sufficient evidence or documentation to support it.
